data.title: Generating demand for Novar brands
data.meta_description: Nigel Stokes has been appointed as head of demand generation for Novar UK & Ireland:
data.text:
Nigel and his team will work closely with developers and mechanical and electrical consultants and contractors in key market sectors, such as housing and commercial, to promote the specification of Novar brands, including MK, Bardic and Ackermann.

Formerly the national sales manager for Twyford Bathrooms, Nigel was previously general sales manager of Caradon Plumbing Solutions, which was sold when Caradon became Novar in 2001. He has considerable experience in specification selling, particularly with housing developers and in the public sector.

About Novar PLC:

Novar PLC’s Intelligent Building Systems (Novar IBS) sector supplies around £600m of products and services to the construction industry worldwide. Employing approximately 6,500 people, it is one of the largest businesses in its field, with operations in over 30 countries in North America, Europe, the Middle East, India, South East Asia and China.

Novar IBS provides a wide range of high quality, leading offerings for electrical and data connectivity, high technology solutions for fire detection and alarm, access control, security, energy management and environmental controls to a diverse range of customers in both public and private sectors. Brands within the Novar IBS portfolio include Ackermann, ADE, Bardic, Brand Rex, Friedland, Gent, MK, Response, Trend and visiOprime.
